sentence.Network_cn: 他是一个直言不讳的人。

sentence.Network_en: It was only because I had no alternative that I was so impolite and plainspoken.
sentence.Network_cn: 我是因为走投无路才那么毫无礼貌,出言不逊.

sentence.Network_en: Let it be no detraction from his merits to say he is plainspoken.
sentence.Network_cn: 说他坦率的时候请别忘记他的那些优点.

entry.tran: 直言不讳的；直截了当的
entry.def: If you say that someone is plain-spoken, you mean that they say exactly what they think, even when they know that what they say may not please other people.

example.ex: ...a plain-spoken American full of scorn for pomp and pretense.
example.tran: 看不惯炫耀和虚伪、直言不讳的一个美国人

means.word_mean: 2. characterized by directness in manner or speech; without subtlety or evasion;

sentences.sentence: "tell me what you think--and you may just as well be frank"
"it is possible to be outspoken without being rude"
